summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, setting the trial start date for November 29, 2021, with jury selection to begin the week of November 15, 2021. The order grants the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act and establishes deadlines for motions in limine and pretrial disclosures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this order is setting the trial schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The United States District Judge who issued this order setting the trial schedule and deadlines.

events.title: Jury Selection Week
events.description: The court orders that jury selection for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial will occur during this week.

events.title: Trial Commencement
events.description: The date set for opening statements to the jury in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial.

events.title: Deadline for Joint Letter
events.description: The parties are ordered to submit a joint letter regarding the pretrial disclosure schedule by this date.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The trial of Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to begin with jury selection the week of November 15, 2021, and opening statements on November 29, 2021.
Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the government's motion to exclude time under the Speedy Trial Act until November 29, 2021, citing the need for defense review of discovery and pretrial preparation.
The order establishes that motions in limine must be fully briefed at least four weeks before the November 29 trial date.
The parties were ordered to meet and confer by phone for at least 30 minutes and submit a joint letter by May 14, 2021, regarding the pretrial disclosure schedule.
